{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3552745,"name":"","username":"wildmustang4903","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wildmustang4903/{size}/263428_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T14:48:31.961Z","cooked":"

Trying to do some fairly simple alignment with Photonvision but we can not make sense of the Yaw value. Numbers we are getting don’t seem to represent rotation relative to the tag.

What should we be using to get robot rotation relative to the tag?

Target.GetYaw() does not seem to be what we want, or are we not interpreting it correctly.

We are C++ and using a simple single camera Photonvision setup at the moment.

Thanks

Check whether you’re using radians or degrees. iirc PV returns in degrees.

So the Yaw is the 2D Yaw. How do I extract the rotation relative to target from the data I get ?
